title: Drowned soul

|   | A cold and hollow apparition of the drowned dead, chained by some lingering attachment to the depths in which it perished. They clamour around the living, sharing the last moments of their watery fate with whatever their pale form touches. |

## Useful Info

**Drowned souls** are fragile summoned [undead](/Undead "Undead") creatures which seek out the living and attempt to drown them, inflicting modest [asphyxiation](/Asphyxiation "Asphyxiation") damage and destroying themselves in the process. They normally only appear when summoned by [merfolk avatars](/Merfolk_avatar "Merfolk avatar").

## Tips & Tricks

- Species that are [amphibious](/Amphibious "Amphibious") ([Barachi](/Barachi "Barachi"), [Merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk"), [Octopode](/Octopode "Octopode")) or otherwise [unbreathing](/Unbreathing "Unbreathing") ([undead](/Undead "Undead"), [Djinni](/Djinni "Djinni"), [Gargoyles](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle")) cannot be damaged by drowned souls, so have little to fear.
- Don't waste time targeting them; the avatar will simply summon more souls, likely faster than you can kill them off. Do what you can to kill the avatar, which instantly banishes all drowned souls.
  - Merfolk avatars will usually flee to deep water if you try to approach them. This makes melee more difficult.

## History

- Drowned souls were added in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14").
html:
Drowned soul

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
drowned soul W 
HP 12-26
HD 13
XP 456
Speed 12
AC 0
EV 13
Will 60
Attack1 0 (touch: drown)


Resistances rC+++
rPois+++
rDrown
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
rSticky
Vulnerabilities Holy
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Open doors
Holiness Undead
Size Medium
Type phantom, drowned soul
Flags Evil
See invisible
Flying
Unbreathing
Speaks
Insubstantial
A cold and hollow apparition of the drowned dead, chained by some lingering attachment to the depths in which it perished. They clamour around the living, sharing the last moments of their watery fate with whatever their pale form touches.

Useful Info

Drowned souls are fragile summoned undead creatures which seek out the living and attempt to drown them, inflicting modest asphyxiation damage and destroying themselves in the process. They normally only appear when summoned by merfolk avatars.

Tips & Tricks

  • Species that are amphibious (Barachi, Merfolk, Octopode) or otherwise unbreathing (undead, Djinni, Gargoyles) cannot be damaged by drowned souls, so have little to fear.
  • Don't waste time targeting them; the avatar will simply summon more souls, likely faster than you can kill them off. Do what you can to kill the avatar, which instantly banishes all drowned souls.
    • Merfolk avatars will usually flee to deep water if you try to approach them. This makes melee more difficult.

History

  • Drowned souls were added in 0.14.

rawPage:
{{version031}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Drowned souls''' are fragile summoned [[undead]] creatures which seek out the living and attempt to drown them, inflicting modest [[asphyxiation]] damage and destroying themselves in the process. They normally only appear when summoned by [[merfolk avatar]]s.

==Tips & Tricks==
*Species that are [[amphibious]] ([[Barachi]], [[Merfolk]], [[Octopode]]) or otherwise [[unbreathing]] ([[undead]], [[Djinni]], [[Gargoyle]]s) cannot be damaged by drowned souls, so have little to fear.
*Don't waste time targeting them; the avatar will simply summon more souls, likely faster than you can kill them off. Do what you can to kill the avatar, which instantly banishes all drowned souls.
**Merfolk avatars will usually flee to deep water if you try to approach them. This makes melee more difficult.

==History==
*Drowned souls were added in [[0.14]].
